creator: jochen.stiepel@dresdner-bank.com
text:
latest CVS version; JDK 1.4.1 !; JDK 1.3.1 has this problem not.
open the Function Helper Dialog and select a function. Click in one value field 
and than try to klick in an other value field and that is not possible. 
Workaround: after clicking in a value field, click in the "Generate" field and 
than you can click in an other value field.

I have observed the same problem, but in most other tables in the GUI eg HTTP 
Request parameters, Test Plan user variables.

My workaround is the same, click in an 'isolated' text field, then click on the 
next table cell to be modified.

The 'Encoded?' column of the HTTP Request parameters does not suffer from the 
problem, I think, and when editing paramters I have picked on a single check 
button as my 'edit toggle' for the text fields I am editing. It has the same 
effect as clicking on an isolated text field, though it also toggles 
the 'Encoded?' value.

My version of JMeter is a CVS checkout from about 23/8, JDK 1.4.1-rc1 on 
WinNT4sp6a.
creator: johnk@nstc.nec.com.au

text:
Fixed in 1.8.1

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 16058 ***
creator: oros@apache.org
